intro: Chlamydocarya gossweileri, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is a low-growing perennial herb that produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant has a fibrous root system adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils. Its leaves are typically covered in fine, silky hairs, which help reduce water loss. Chlamydocarya gossweileri is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in desert environments.
